p.span:
We understand and recognize that these are challenging times for everyone. Some may be feeling quite overwhelmed. For this reason, we will begin posting information to support overall well-being. These posts will be age-appropriate and made throughout each week. This post is intended for elementary-aged students and is brought to you by Sesame Street. Please share with anyone that may find the information helpful. Check back often for posts geared to older students and parents, as well. Stay well.
***
Hey kids, can you name all of these emotions? Play "Name that Emotion" and try to figure out what emotion they are feeling?
It's okay to have lots of feelings at the same time. If you're feeling down, talk about it with your mom or dad. If you're feeling happy, let your parents know that too!
www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZxfJicfyCdg&feature=youtu.be

Congratulations to all of the grant recipients South Central Jr./Sr. High School!! Thank you to Harrison County Community Foundation for your continued support of the scholarship program and to all community members who support these initiatives through establishments of funds and donations!The Harrison County Community Foundation announces scholarship awards for South Central Jr./Sr. High School.
This year, the foundation will be announcing scholarship awards one high school at a time. Award packets are being mailed to South Central High School recipients this week.
Stay tuned for the next round of award announcements coming soon!
South Central High School Building Our Future Scholarship Awards
Four graduating students from South Central High School will receive Building Our Future Scholarship awards from the Harrison County Community Foundation. The scholarship, which is up to $2,500 a year, is renewable for four years or a total value of up to $10,000 per recipient.
Congratulations to: Jude Baker, Caden Cunningham, Annabelle Faith & Kaitlyn Harl!
South Central High School Indiana University Southeast Scholarship
The Harrison County Community Foundation is awarding one renewable scholarship to a graduating high school student at each Harrison County high school who plans to attend Indiana University Southeast. Each of these students will receive $5,000 scholarships, renewable for four years, for a total of $20,000.
Congratulations to South Central High School recipient Alyssa Pumphrey!
South Central High School Founders Vocational Scholarships
The Harrison County Community Foundation Board of Directors recognizes the importance of vocational and technical education. Founder’s Scholarships are awarded at various levels depending upon the graduating student’s academic/vocational history and planned course of study.
Recipients and amounts of the vocational scholarships awarded at South Central High School are: Preston Hedden - $5,000
In addition, the following endowed scholarship awards are:
-Alex Simmons Memorial Scholarship to Preston Hedden - $750
-Clarence A. Sr. and Olivia T. Merk Memorial Scholarship to Jude Baker - $750
-Crandall Masonic Lodge 591 Josh Beanblossom Memorial Scholarship to Marie Goodwin - $1,500
-Donald and Fredrica Dones Scholarship to Austin Tyree - $1,000
-Helen J. Cunningham Community Service Scholarship to Austin Tyree & Suzanne Simpson - $500
-Laconia Lions Club Scholarship to Brenden Beebee & Josy Pinnick - $1,200
-Madge Ashton Memorial Scholarship to Madison Holland - $200
-South Central High School Scholarship to Austin Tyree - $300
Congratulations to all award winners. Your packets are in the mail. Please open and respond immediately!

img.alt: Congratulations to all of the grant recipients South Central Jr./Sr. High School!! Thank you to Harrison County Community Foundation for your continued support of the scholarship program and to all community members who support these initiatives through establishments of funds and donations!

p.span:
Usually, the gymnasium is filled with students and activities. Now, it waits to welcome students back to play. There is lots of activity just down the hallway as staff members ready themselves for another day of food distribution. You can still sign up to receive the meals by completing this short form:
forms.gle/C4csZrV4vgpJotgz9
Enjoy this beautiful day and stay well.

img.alt:

p.span:
Thank you, Harrison REMC, for this opportunity for families in need of assistance. Please call 812-738-4115 if you need assistance.
If you need financial assistance with payment of utilities, food, etc. please reach out to Harrison County Community Services for help. There are many agencies to support you and your families.Harrison REMC understands the important role we have with your family and in our community. We’ve been a trusted community partner for 82 years, and it’s that community focus that drives us during this time. If you’re unable to pay your bill on time and in full, we encourage you to contact the electric cooperative as soon as possible to make payment arrangements. 812-738-4115 or 812-951-2323 #WereHereForYou #PowerOn

img.alt:
Thank you, Harrison REMC, for this opportunity for families in need of assistance. Please call 812-738-4115 if you need assistance.
If you need financial assistance with payment of utilities, food, etc. please reach out to Harrison County Community Services for help. There are many agencies to support you and your families.

p.span: Sharing for our families that may be eligible. So thankful for our supportive community.

img.alt: Sharing for our families that may be eligible. So thankful for our supportive community.

div.p: Thank you so much for sharing!
